text: General elections were held in Cambodia on 9 September 1951.Dieter Nohlen, Florian Grotz & Christof Hartmann (2001) Elections in Asia: A data handbook, Volume II, p63 The Democratic Party won 54 of the 78 seats.Nohlen et al., p74 ==Results== {| class="wikitable" |colspan=9|300px |- ! colspan="2" style="text-align: center; font-weight:bold;" | Party ! style="text-align: center; font-weight:bold;" | Votes ! style="text-align: center; font- weight:bold;" | % ! style="text-align: center; font-weight:bold;" | Seats ! style="text-align: center;" | +/– |- | style="background-color:#800080; color:#800080;" | | Democratic Party | | style="text-align: right;" | | style="text-align: right;" | 54 | style="text-align: right;" | +10 |- | style="background-color:#FAAC58; color:#FAAC58;" | | Liberal Party | | style="text-align: right;" | | style="text-align: right;" | 18 | style="text- align: right;" | –3 |- | style="background-color:red; color:red;" | | Victorious North-East Party | | style="text-align: right;" | | style="text- align: right;" | 4 | style="text-align: right;" | New |- | style="background- color:Blue;" | | Khmer Renovation | | | style="text-align: right;" | 2 | style="text-align: right;" | New |- | style="background-color:#9b9b9b;" | | Independents | | | style="text-align: right;" | 0 | style="text-align: right;" | –10 |- | | Invalid/Blank votes | | style="text-align: right;" | – | style="text-align: right;" | – | style="text-align: right;" | – |- | colspan="2" style="font-weight:bold;" | Total | | style="text-align: right;" | | style="text-align: right; font-weight:bold;" | 78 | style="text-align: right;" | +3 |- | colspan="6" | Source: Nohlen et al. |} ==References== Category:1951 elections in Asia Category:Elections in Cambodia Category:1951 in Cambodia
title: 1951 Cambodian general election
